intro: Microchilus procerus, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and gelatinous, sticky berries. The plant derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized structures called haustoria, while also performing photosynthesis. It is typically found in temperate regions and is often associated with specific host species such as oaks and elms. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have a significant impact on the health of its host trees.
